| **VERIFICATION OF THE HARA PLAN** | |
| 1.Has information been received about review of literature, new hazards or emergence of new risks, legislation (raw materials, manufacturing or products), codes of practice or industry standards that need to be reflected in the HARA Plan?  What Changed:  - BRCGS Issue 7 Packaging Materials standard introduced enhanced requirements for:  - Physical verification of process flows (Clause 2.4.2)  - Building fabric assessment in HARA (Clause 2.5.1)  - Peer validation for critical control steps (Clause 5.4.9)  - Traceability through conversion processes (Clause 5.8.2)  When Changed:  - BRCGS Issue 7 published: January 2022  - First Kangopak audit under Issue 7: September 6-9, 2025  - Gap identified: September 9, 2025  - HARA updates initiated: September 24, 2025  How Changed:  - HARA updated from Rev 28 to Rev 29 to include:  - Building Fabric Assessment section with "Look UP, AROUND, DOWN" methodology  - Skylight bird ingress hazard added (14 skylights documented)  - Infrastructure hazard assessment protocol  - Quarterly building envelope inspections  Supporting Evidence:  - BRCGS-Audit-Findings-Critical-Issues-Identified-in-Detail  - NC2\_Skylight\_Closeout  - Training\_Building\_Fabric\_HARA | Yes [x]  No [ ] |
| 2. Do any corrective action or non-conformity reports show that any changes need to be made to the HARA system?  NC 1: Process Flow Verification (Clause 2.4.2 - Fundamental Requirement)  What Changed:  - HARA procedure now requires physical verification with documented evidence  - Physical walk-through protocol added with photographic documentation requirement  When Changed:  - Audit finding: September 9, 2025  - Root cause analysis: September 24, 2025  - Procedure 2.2 updated to Rev 12: September 30, 2025  - Implementation: October 1, 2025  How Changed:  - Procedure 2.2 BRC Hazard and Risk Management Rev 11 → Rev 12:  - RED text used to show all changes in document  Evidence Created:  - Annotated photos of physical verification  - Updated Procedure 2.2 Rev 12 with RED text changes  - Training completed for Risk Team members (26 September 2025)  - Evidence file: NC 1/NC 1 - Evidence - Physical On-Site Verification  NC 2: Skylight Assessment (Clause 2.5.1)  What Changed:  - HARA Rev 27 → Rev 28: Added building fabric hazards  - Skylights added to HARA Section 2.1 with risk assessment  - Control measures implemented  - Cross-reference procedure created between Glass Register and HARA  When Changed:  - Audit finding: September 9, 2025  - Skylights already on Glass Register (5.8F1 Rev 32) but missing from HARA  - HARA updated: September 30, 2025  How Changed:  - HARA Document Rev 27 → Rev 28:  - New Section: Building & Infrastructure Hazard Assessment  - Added skylights with risk assessments  - Risk severity: MEDIUM (physical contamination via brokage or pest ingress)  - Control measure: Monthly inspection + sealing integrity checks  - Monitoring: Glass & Brittle Plastic + Maintenance records + pest control reports  - Responsibility: Systems Co Ordinator + Maintenance Technician  Evidence Created:  - NC 2/NC 2 - Evidence - Hazard and Risk Assessment (Rev 29)  - NC 2/NC 2 - Evidence - Glass & Brittle Plastic Register  - Building fabric training: "Beyond the Process" 2-hour course  - Training register: Risk Team members certified  NC 3: Line Clearance Validation (Clause 5.4.9)  What Changed:  - Line clearance validation changed from "superior only" to "any trained person"  - Peer validation now permitted (not just supervisory validation)  - Physical plastic holders installed at all machines for job card management  When Changed:  - Audit finding: September 9, 2025 (4am night shift self-validation incident)  - Root cause analysis: September 24, 2025  - Procedure 5.3 updated to Rev 14: September 30, 2025  - Plastic holders installed.  - Validator training.  - Full implementation: October 1, 2025  How Changed:  - Procedure 5.3 Process Control Rev 13 → Rev 14:  - Section 5.3.7 added: "Line Clearance and Changeover Validation"  - Changed wording from "validated by a superior" to "validated by another trained person"  - Added validator qualification requirements  - Added photographic evidence requirement for allergen changeovers  - RED text used to show all changes  Operational Changes:  - Operators & Packers certified as validators  - Plastic holders installed at every machine:  "Future Jobs" holder  "Completed Jobs" holder  Evidence Created:  - NC 3/NC 3 - Evidence - Process Control Procedure Rev 14  - NC 3/NC 3 - Evidence - Plastic Holder.jpg  - NC 3/NC 3 - Evidence - Validation - Line Clearance.jpg  - Training slides: NC3\_Training\_Line\_Clearance\_Validation  - Training register  NC 4: Slitting Material Identification (Clause 5.8.2)  What Changed:  - Traceability procedure updated to require immediate labelling of ALL slitting outputs  - Work In Progress (WIP) for slitting now explicitly requires labelling (no exceptions)  - New Section added: "Slitting Operations Identification"  - "Split It? Label It!" rule implemented company-wide  When Changed:  - Audit finding: September 9, 2025 (unidentified reels found mixed with WO FES)  - Root cause analysis: September 25, 2025  - Procedure 3.9 updated to Rev 11: September 30, 2025  - Immediate manual labelling implemented: October 1, 2025  How Changed:  - Procedure 3.9 Traceability Rev 10 → Rev 11:  - New Section 3.9.5: "Slitting Operations Identification" added in RED text  - Mandatory label requirements for ALL slitting outputs:  Original batch/lot number  Reel/roll number (e.g., 1 of 4)  Date of slitting operation  Operator initials  Status (WIP or Finished Goods)  - WIP explicitly included in labelling requirements  - No unlabelled materials permitted at end of shift  - Segregation requirement for different batches  - "Split It? Label It!" principle documented  Physical Implementation:  - Label template redesigned with "Source Reel ID" field  Evidence Created:  - NC 4/NC 4 - Evidence - Traceability Procedure (Rev 11)  - Training slides: NC4\_Training\_Slides\_Slitting (Slides - "Split It? Label It!")  - Training completed: Slitting operators + material handlers | Yes [x]  No [ ] |

What Changed:  - Cross-functional input required for procedure updates  When Changed:  - Identified: September 30, 2025  How Changed:  - Management commitment to annual procedure reviews  - Procedures must reflect actual practice, not ideal practice  - Operators involved in procedure development | Yes [x]  No [ ] |

| 6. Have any third-party audit reports indicated that the HARA system needs changing?  Audit Details:  - Auditor: Andrew Walker, NSF  - Audit Dates: September 8-9, 2025  - Standard: BRCGS Issue 7 Packaging Materials  - Result: Grade AA  - Four non-conformities identified  HARA Changes Required:  1. Physical Verification (NC 1)  - HARA procedure lacked physical evidence requirement  - Updated Procedure 2.2 to Rev 12 with verification protocol  2. Building Assessment (NC 2)  - HARA missing infrastructure hazards  - Updated HARA to Rev 29 with building fabric section  3. Validation Controls (NC 3)  - HARA control measure too restrictive (superior validation only)  - Updated Procedure 5.3 to Rev 14 allowing peer validation  4. Traceability (NC 4)  - HARA traceability checkpoints incomplete  - Updated Procedure 3.9 to Rev 11 adding conversion processes | | | Yes [x]  No [ ] |
| 7. Have there been a need to conduct Functional Packaging Claim review.  No changes to functional packaging claims. No new products or packaging performance requirements identified during audit. | | | Yes [ ]  No [x] |
| 8. Do the GMP Hygiene Audits show any problems being identified on a regular basis?  Monitoring Enhanced  No regular problems identified. However, monitoring frequency increased:  - Line clearance validation.  - Slitting traceability. | | | Yes [ ]  No [x] |
| **REVIEW OF THE HARA PLAN** | | |  |
| 1. Do any critical limits and specifications require changing or amending? | | | Yes [ ]  No [x] |
| 2. Are the methods of control inadequate for the hazard/s at any process stage?  Control Methods Enhanced  NC 3: Line Clearance Control Enhanced  What Was Inadequate:  - Single-person verification is insufficient for preventing cross-contamination  - No independent verification of clearance accuracy  - Self-validation created single point of failure  What Changed:  - Added peer validation requirement  - Minimum 2 qualified validators per shift  - Visual management tools (plastic holders) added  When Changed:  - Implemented: 1 October 2025  How Changed:  - Procedure 5.3 Rev 14: Mandatory two-person verification  - Stop authority formalized for validators  NC 4: Traceability Control Enhanced  What Was Inadequate:  - Slitting process broke traceability chain  - No source reel identification on WIP rolls  - Recall capability compromised  What Changed:  - Source reel ID now mandatory on all slitting outputs  - Immediate labeling required (no delays)  - WIP explicitly included in traceability  When Changed:  - Manual system: October 1, 2025  How Changed:  - Manual input of source ID (immediate) | | | Yes [x]  No [ ] |
| 3. Have there been any changes raw materials or Supplier of raw materials? | | | Yes [ ]  No [x] |
| 4. Are any changes required to the CCPs? | | | Yes [ ]  No [x] |
| 5. Have any specifications / critical limits been exceeded on a regular basis at any process stage? | | | Yes [ ]  No [x] |
| 6. Are there any changes required to the monitoring procedures? | | | Yes [ ]  No [x] |
| 7. Are any additional corrective actions required at a process stage?  See Comprehensive Summary Below  NC 1: Process Flow Verification - Additional Corrective Actions:  Immediate Actions (Completed):  1. Conducted physical verification of all process flows with 38 photos  2. Updated Procedure 2.2 to Rev 12 with evidence requirement  3. Trained all Risk Team members on new protocol  NC 2: Skylight Assessment - Additional Corrective Actions:  Immediate Actions (Completed):  1. Skylights added to HARA Rev 28  2. Glass Register cross-checked against HARA  3. "Beyond the Process" training developed for Risk Team  4. Building fabric assessment added to annual HARA review  NC 3: Line Clearance Validation - Additional Corrective Actions:  Immediate Actions (Completed):  1. Plastic holders installed on all machines (October 3, 2025)  2. Procedure 5.3 updated to Rev 14 with peer validation  3. Validator certification: 4-hour training + competency test (October 8-28, 2025)  4. "Everyone Can Validate" training materials created  NC 4: Slitting Material Identification - Additional Corrective Actions:  Immediate Actions (Completed):  1. Materials segregated by batch  2. Procedure 3.9 updated to Rev 11 with Section 3.9.5 | | | Yes [x]  No [ ] |
| 8. Have there been any changes which require the process changes and process descriptions to be changed?  Process Flow Updates Required  NC 1: Process Flow Diagrams  What Changed:  - All process flow diagrams verified against physical reality  - Process flow diagrams updated to reflect current state  When Changed:  - Physical verification  - HARA updated with corrected flows  How Changed:  - Photos taken of actual process flows  - Each photo annotated with process step reference  - Process flow diagrams in HARA Rev 28  NC 4: Slitting Process Description  What Changed:  - Traceability requirements added to process description  - Labeling steps added to standard operating procedure  How Changed:  - Slitting process now explicitly documented as:  1. Load master roll → Record ID in production log sheet  2. Slit to customer widths → Label each output IMMEDIATELY  3. Verify source ID on all outputs → Quality check  4. Segregate by batch → Physical separation  5. Move to storage → Labeled and identified | | | Yes [x]  No [ ] |

| 21. Have there been any changes in staff levels or responsibilities?  Role Clarifications and Additions  NC 3: Validator Role Created  When Changed:  - Role created: September 30, 2025  How Changed:  - Minimum 2 validators per shift for coverage  - Validators have stopped authority for product safety issues  Staffing Challenges Identified:  - Lean staffing (single team leader)  - Triggered NC 3 because superior validation not possible  - Solution: Peer validation allowed, multiple validators certified  Responsibility Clarifications:  Procedure 2.2 (NC 1):  - HARA Risk Team Leader: Owns physical verification  HARA Rev 28 (NC 2):  - Maintenance Manager: Physical building integrity  - Systems Co-Ordinator: Glass & Brittle Plastic Check & Pest control evidence  Procedure 5.3 (NC 3):  - Validators: Independent verification of line clearance  - Production Manager: Ensure validator availability  Procedure 3.9 (NC 4):  - Slitting Operators: Immediate labeling of outputs  - Commercial Manager: Yearly traceability testing | | | Yes [ ]  No [ ] |
| 22. Has a walkthrough of any production process shown the process flow diagram to be incorrect?  NC 1 Finding  - Complete physical walk-through conducted with 38 photos  - Each photo annotated with process step  - Process flow diagrams verified in HARA Rev 28  - All equipment positions verified.  - Annual verification ensures ongoing accuracy | | | Yes [ ]  No [x] |
| 23. Having followed a product through the production process, does it show that monitoring and/or traceability procedures are not being followed?  NC 4 Finding  What Was Not Being Followed:  - Slitting outputs not consistently labeled with source reel ID  - Traceability chain broken during conversion process  - Slitting WIP materials assumed exempt from labeling  When Discovered:  - Audit: September 9, 2025  - Specific incident: Unidentified slit reels mixed with WO.  How Corrected:  - Procedure 3.9 Rev 11: Explicit slitting labeling requirement  - Section 3.9.5 added for slitting operations  - WIP explicitly included in labeling requirements  - "Split It? Label It!" rule implemented  - Immediate labeling mandatory (no delays)  Monitoring Enhanced:  -Yearly traceability testing. | | | Yes [x]  No [ ] |

Procedure 2.2 BRC Hazard and Risk Management (Rev 11 → Rev 12)  What Changed:  - Photo evidence requirement  How Changed:  - All changes shown in RED text in document  - Rev 12 dated: September 30, 2025  Training Required:  - Risk Team members  Evidence:  - NC 1/NC 1 - Evidence - Hazard and Risk Management Procedure  2. HARA Document (Rev 27 → Rev 28)  What Changed:  - Building fabric hazards added  - Skylights with risk assessments  How Changed:  - HARA team meeting: September 24, 2025  - Cross-functional review  - Approved by: HARA Team (4 signatures)  Training Required:  - Risk Team members  - "Beyond the Process" 2-hour course  - Building hazard identification training  Evidence:  - NC 2/NC 2 - Evidence - Hazard and Risk Assessment  - Training materials: Training\_Building\_Fabric\_HARA  3. Procedure 5.3 BRCGS Process Control (Rev 13 → Rev 14)  What Changed:  - Section 5.3.7 added: Line Clearance and Changeover Validation  - "Superior" changed to "another trained person"  How Changed:  - All changes shown in RED text  Training Required:  - All production personnel  Evidence:  - NC 3/NC 3 - Evidence - Process Control Procedure Rev 14  - Training materials: NC3\_Training\_Line\_Clearance\_Validation  - Training register: NC 3/NC 3 - Evidence - Line Clearance Validation Training Register  4. Procedure 3.9 BRCGS Traceability (Rev 10 → Rev 11)  What Changed:  - Section 3.9.5 added: Slitting Operations Identification  - Immediate labelling requirement for ALL slitting outputs  - WIP explicitly included  - Label requirements specified (5 mandatory fields)  - Segregation requirements  - "Split It? Label It!" principle documented  How Changed:  - Section added in RED text  Training Required:  - Slitting operators and material handlers  - 30-minute on-the-job training  Evidence:  - NC 4/NC 4 - Evidence - Traceability Procedure  - Training materials: NC4\_Training\_Slides\_Slitting  - Training register: signed training attendance registers  Production Process Changes:  Line Clearance Process:  - Add peer validation step before production start  - Validator reviews clearance checklist  - Operator/packer and validator sign documentation  - Stop authority if issues found  Slitting Process:  - Operator applies WIP label with source reel ID on each roll  Building Maintenance:  - Skylight integrity checks – glass & brittle plastic  - Pest evidence monitoring  HARA Verification:  - Annual physical walk-through  - Photo documentation  - Results filed with HARA documentation | | | |
